conversation.content: So you're telling me that [cry] vocal coaches actually make people meow like cats for warm-ups?
Well, um, it sounds ridiculous but, you know, those exercises actually help with breath control and, basically, loosening up the vocal cords before serious training begins.
Wait wait, so, are you saying, like, professional singers are just, err, secretly cat people?
Not exactly - I mean, the meowing is just one technique, and honestly, we also do sirens, lip trills, and, uhh, tongue twisters that would make your head spin.
Do they, um, also make you [child-like] talk like babies, you know, to find your, actually, "natural voice"?
Oh god, well, there's this [shy] thing called, er, "vocal regression" where, basically, we explore different registers, but it's, you know, more scientific than just baby talk!
I bet, hmm, you secretly love the, like, meowing part though, anyway, don't you?
Look, between you and me, the meowing is actually pretty liberating once you get over the initial embarrassment of sounding like a deranged house pet.
Have you, uh, ever accidentally meowed in, sort of, public after too much practice?
Okay so, there was this one time at Starbucks where I, umm, ordered my latte and, basically, a little trill slipped out at the end.
Please tell me someone recorded that magnificent moment.
Thank god no - but, honestly, the barista looked at me like I'd, err, lost my mind and asked if I, you know, needed medical attention.
What other embarrassing exercises do they torture you with?
Oh there's the "motorboat" where you blow raspberries for minutes on end, plus this thing called "the siren" where you slide from your lowest to highest note like an ambulance.
I'm just, like, [belly laugh] imagining a room full of adults, actually, making these sounds, you know, completely seriously!
The [sniffle] worst part is when newcomers walk in during warm-ups and see twenty adults buzzing their lips and mooing in unison - their faces are absolutely priceless.
Do you, umm, ever question your, basically, life choices during these moments?
Every single session! But then I hit a [loudly] perfect high C after all that ridiculous preparation and suddenly the cat noises seem worth it.
So, uh, if I wanted to, [monotone] like, improve my speaking voice, honestly, would I have to meow too?
Actually, for speaking you'd, well, probably just do humming and, I guess, resonance exercises, but hey, the meowing is, you know, always there if you want the full experience!
